<title level="1" right="Rules">[Grid Movement](/Rules.aspx?ID=2356)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 421 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
If an encounter involves combat, it’s often a good idea to track the movement and relative position of the participants using a Pathfinder Flip-Mat or some other form of grid to display the terrain, and miniatures to represent the combatants. When a character moves on a grid, every 1-inch square of the play area is 5 feet across in the game world. Hence, a creature moving in a straight line spends 5 feet of its movement for every map square traveled. [Difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=2366) can make some squares cost more of your movement.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
